reviewText:
Early Access Review

You are a triangle in front of static, stock images of space, shooting at squares, octagons, stars and also other triangles (if you have someone to play it with. Local multiplayer only.)
Basically it's another Asteroids clone we already got an abundance of in the past 40 years (almost.)

At first, I wanted to give it a positive review (since there is no meh" option
date: ) because while very unpolished and not really good looking
recommended: it's not fundamentally bad. Although the multiplayer aspect does nothing for me since it is local only.\nBut then
hoursPlayed: when I actually sat down to write the review
voteText: I started to think
helpfulPercent: "Is there anything I can say about this game that would put it above other asteroids clones?" and I couldn't think of a single thing. Even if we would look at Steam games only
votesHelpful: every other Asteroids clone I found offers way more
votesTotal: is more unique in terms of both gameplay and visuals
votesFunny: and some of them just look gorgeous even though they are games about shapes shooting each other.\nAccording to the developer
commentsCount: he created this game with focus on different physics being implemented in the controls. To be frank
column16: I'm not such an avid player of the Asteroids to feel that difference
column17:
but it may be different for other people.
Feel free to download the demo of the game (link available on the store page) to see how it handles for yourself.

The only thing about this game
column18: is that it's relatively cheaper than the other clones on Steam.\nAlso note that it is still an early access game
column20: the developer of this one seems to want to actually finish his game
column21: so it may still get better later on."
column25: 27 of 37 people (73%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've been here with this game since it was posted on Greenlight. I honestly loved the game and I knew it was going to get on Steam. Pepys is a very nice and kind developer. I know he's doing everything he can to make the best game! I'm really excited for it to come out of Early Access! There are some things I'm very excited for on Space Drifters 2D. One thing I'm really excited and hyped for is Online Multiplayer. This game is fun doing singleplayer, but even more fun during Multiplayer. I trust Pepys instincts and I know this game will be better in the future than it is right now! Great job Pepys, I can't wait to see the future updates for this game, and maybe even new games!

Developer's Reply: But just to make sure everyone understands, Online Multiplayer isn't a planned feature for 1.0. However, if and when I am capable of making the multiplayer work it is a feature I truly believe would be good for this game. For now it's not something I can promise.

Updated Review

As Of Sept 08 2015 the dev has put alot of work into this, and it really feels like a complete game with single player modes, and a good variaty of local multiplayer game modes. Great sountracks/effects and a good scoring system, every thing you need in a game that will keep you and friends entertained for hours, drifting away in deep space blasting way.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'd say Geometry wars: indie edition.

+ : space flying, shooting octagons 'n' stuff, price is good, trading cards, many modes, coop mode, gamepad support, fun and simple, super music

- : there is no brake, you have to turn around and accelerate but I think it is a good feature, negative just for me because I get dizzy :( :D

Overall, it's a GG, you get what you buy. 9/10 would drift again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As far as I'm concerned, for the price its worth it.


The main thing I have to highlight on is the atmosphere the game gives you. I must admit that the controls are a little clunky and weird to get used too. However once you do and coat yourself in the music and simplicity of the game, I found it to be pretty calming. Also its art design is neat.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A very awesome take on the Asteroids forumla. Controls are spot on and the music fits the game perfectly.

I especially like the differing enemies in endless mode instead of just the plain Asteroid as it makes the game much more tense.

Asteroid Dodge is a great diversion from the endless mode and tasks you with staying alive as long as you can without being able to shoot.

A fun game to play!

reviewText:
It is a spinoff of asteroids with some new play modes and multiplayer added. I don't recommend this game simply because it feels unfinished. I would expect an indie game to be a little unpolished, but this one is too much so. The developers have a great thing going and I could see this being very fun if they just finished making it.

For example, asteroid defense gives you limited shots, but does not display that anywhere, the asteroids" are just squares with no curvature at all. Race mode does not show what lap the player is on. I had a little trouble even figuring out what the track was.

The game is lacking some basic animation as well. Unlike the Asteroids game we know and love
date: the asteroids do not break apart or even appear to explode. They literally just disappear when hit. Not even a few pixel dots scatter.\n\nSo overall I found it disappointing to say the least. An otherwise great and probably well-selling game fell short due to some lazy programming. I would say to the creators to pick it back up and just focus on user experience. Everything else is there."
